children.name: id
children.label: Add menu
children.help_text: The menu tree is the page structure which generates the items in the menu. A single menu tree can be used with multiple menus. You can create multiple menus for complex website structures. Menus are created and managed in your Content Settings

children.name: lang_slug
children.label: Specify language slug
children.help_text: Specify the language slug. E.g. NL, EN, FR, ...

name: root_type
label: Specify type of menu
help_text: Advanced menus show different portions of a menu tree based on which page is being viewed.
choices: Static - Always show top-level pages in menu
Dynamic by section - Show pages in menu that are related to section being viewed
Dynamic by page - Show pages in menu that are related to page being viewed
Breadcrumb style path menu (uses horizontal flow)

name: max_levels
label: Specify number of levels
help_text: Determines the number of menu tree children that can be expanded in the menu

name: flow
label: Set orientation of menu
help_text: Horizontal menus display items side-by-side, and vertical menus are top-to-bottom

name: flyouts
label: Enable submenu
help_text: Child menu items will appear when you hover over the parent. If unchecked, child menu items will always appear
